titleInfo.title: Honorary citizenship presented by Mayor Briley to William L. Slayton, 1964 March 30

mods.identifier: RG 3 5306 Wm L Slayton Honorary citizen Mar30 1964 001

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: Pictured from left to right: Nashville Mayor Beverly Briley presenting an honorary citizenship of Metropolitan Nashville and Davidson County to William L. Slayton on March 30th, 1964. Slayton acted against racial discrimination as commissioner of urban renewal in the Kennedy and Johnson administrations. He worked for the Housing and Home Finance Agency and as an urban renewal expert for the Ford Foundation before President John F. Kennedy chose him in 1961 to be commissioner of the Urban Renewal Administration. Slayton held the post until 1966. He went on to become president of Urban America Inc., a nonprofit organization in Washington; other posts he held in his later years included Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for Foreign Buildings. Forms part of Record Group 3, Metro Davidson County Photographer. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.

titleInfo.title: Record Group 3 Metro Davidson County Photographer
